body_html: Alright, thus instead of using int32 everywhere I suggest using int64 everywhere in order to maintain consistency. Or, if not everywhere, at leat use the same type for attributes that works togeather, i.e. shape and dimensions (as input and/or output parameters) should be both int64.
body_text: Alright, thus instead of using int32 everywhere I suggest using int64 everywhere in order to maintain consistency. Or, if not everywhere, at leat use the same type for attributes that works togeather, i.e. shape and dimensions (as input and/or output parameters) should be both int64.
body: Alright, thus instead of using `int32` everywhere I suggest using `int64` everywhere in order to maintain consistency. Or, if not everywhere, at leat use the same type for attributes that works togeather, i.e. shape and dimensions (as input and/or output parameters) should be both `int64`.
